intro: Arrabidaea crassa, commonly known as the rough arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its robust, woody stems and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers are typically clustered in racemes, adding visual interest to its appearance. Arrabidaea crassa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
